programme.desc: No. 3 Duke (23-3) won three-straight games after an 80-62 win over Virginia behind 17 points and 14 rebounds from Cooper Flagg, who is third in ACC scoring with 19.7 ppg; Illinois (17-10) dropped its last two games, both to ranked opponents.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova and Providence split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Wildcats winning the final matchup on Feb. 21, 2024, with a 68-58 scoreline; Lucy Olsen posted 30 points and 5 assists for Villanova in the home win.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State claimed a 67-62 victory over Baylor in the 2024 Big 12 Championship quarter-finals round on March 9, led by Audi Crooks' 23 points and 6 rebounds; Dre'Nna Edwards posted 17 points and 7 rebounds for the Bears in the loss.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron became only the fourth driver to win back-to-back Daytona 500 races after taking the opener over Tyler Reddick; Daniel Suarez averaged 115.398 mph en route to his win last year, defeating Ryan Blaney by 0.003 seconds.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UConn (18-8, 10-5) won four of its last six games; No. 10 St. John's (23-4, 14-2) is 16-0 at home, and defeated the Huskies, 68-62, on Feb. 7 behind 21 points from RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.6 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 14 Michigan State (21-5, 12-3) comes off a 75-66 win over No. 13 Purdue, and won both meetings last season; No. 12 Michigan (20-5, 12-2) won six-straight games, and is 12-0 at home behind Vladislav Goldin, who leads the team with 15.7 ppg.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: NASCAR Truck Series drivers qualify for the Fr8 208, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Daniel Dye averaged 174.246 mph en route to winning the pole last year but would finish the race in ninth place.

programme.desc: Bermuda U20 won its last CONCACAF U20 qualifier after defeating Anguilla U20, 3-1, on April 18, 2023; Trinidad & Tobago U20 seeks its best finish in the tournament since earning a fourth-place finish in the 2014 edition held in the Cayman Islands.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: North Queensland (0-0-1) defeated the Storm in Round 26 last season with a 38-30 victory in Round 26, as Kyle Feldt scored two tries in the first half, while Valentine Holmes had 18 points; Melbourne (0-0-1) fell to New Zealand, 36-10, on Feb. 14.

programme.desc: Newcastle (0-0-1) suffered a 44-18 setback to Parramatta on Feb. 14; Sydney (0-0-1) has won seven of the past eight encounters against the Knights, including a 22-20 triumph last season in Round 6, as Daniel Tupou notched two tries.
